result.execSummary:
The defendant Walter O Collier was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).
  • Intentionally Sell Dang. Weapon to Child, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.60(2)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges. 
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
As to all costs, surcharges and restitution (if applicable), Court orders DOC shall collect up to 25% of prison funds.  Remaining balance to be paid during the period of extended supervision.  Unpaid amount to covert to the civil judgment.  
As to restitution, Court finds victim has not provided sufficient information to support claim.  Victim to provide proper documentation to the State within 90 days, State to file motion.  If information is not submitted within 90 days (by 8/1/16), Court orders restitution to be set at $0.
Consecutive to: (CONSECUTIVE TO COUNT 3), with credit for 531 days time served.

superMiscConds.notes: No contact with victim, Shiqueal D.
Comply with any other conditions deemed appropriate by agent.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Walter O Collier in court with attorney Scott Douglas Connors.  Defendant Walter O Collier in custody.  Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court finds State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing hearing held.  Court finds discrepancy in plea form.  Defense counsel makes changes and reviews form with defendant.  Court makes record.  Statements made as to sentencing.  
AS TO COUNT 1:  The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 7 YEARS (CONSECUTIVE TO COUNT 3), with credit for 531 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  
AS TO COUNT 3:  The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 2 YEARS (CONSECUTIVE TO COUNT 1); the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR.  
The defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".
As conditions of extended supervision, the Court orders;
* No contact with victim, Shiqueal D.
* Comply with any other conditions deemed appropriate by agent.  
As to restitution, Court finds victim has not provided sufficient information to support claim.  Victim to provide proper documentation to the State within 90 days, State to file motion.  If information is not submitted within 90 days (by 8/1/16), Court orders restitution to be set at $0.  
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges. 
As to all costs, surcharges and restitution (if applicable), Court orders DOC shall collect up to 25% of prison funds.  Remaining balance to be paid during the period of extended supervision.  Unpaid amount to covert to the civil judgment.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 

Filed,
Plea Questionnaire (updated pg 1)
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Restitution Worksheet/Crime Victim Impact Statement.

Defendant Walter O Collier in court with attorney Scott Douglas Connors.  Defendant Walter O Collier in custody.  Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is scheduled for jury trial today.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNT 1 and COUNT 3.  Based on negotiations of the parties and on motion of the State, Court orders Use of a Dangerous Weapon enhancer as to COUNT 1 DISMISSED and COUNT 2 DISMISSED AND READ-IN.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Plea questionnaire received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms or body armor.  Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court orders defendant REMANDED pending sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 3, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
